intro: Pedicularis orbelica, commonly known as the Orbelia lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or moist soil. It produces showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, attracting pollinators like bees and flies. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
